question: Which high court makes Vande Mataram mandatory in schools, govt and private offices?
explanation: The Madras High Court ruled that Vande Mataram should be sung in all schools and colleges across the state "at least once a week", and in government and private offices at least once a month. To insist a sense of patriotism in each and every citizen of the state, the national song 'Vande Mataram' shall be played and sung in all schools, colleges, universities and other educational institutions at least once a week (preferably on Monday or Friday).
